1.Rathadshamsum Rakbān has dedicated to 2.Dhū-Samāy, god of ʾAmīrum, lord of 3.Watarum, this bronze (statue of a) female camel whose name is 4.ʾAshfūfum, because his lord had granted him 5. to acquire booty(?) in his first year (in the field?) 6.[… ..] and because he (i.e. the dedicant) had returned in safe- 7.ty from the land of Ḥimyar. And may 8.Dhū-Samāy con[tin]ue to grant him the esteem and 9.good-pleasure of their two lords, ʾĪlsharaḥ Ya- 10.ḥḍub and his brother Yaʾzil Bayyin, the 11.two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān, the two sons of Fāri- 12.ʿum Yanhub, king of Sabaʾ. And may he (i.e. the god) 13.continue to grant him [… … …]
